comments.commentBody:
Google "narcissistic injury". It will explain everything about Trump's response to any perceived criticism.

The man is patently unfit to run a hot dog cart, never mind the presidency...

President Obama should sue DJT for libel. I’m sure these accusations are causing the Obama-line of business attire to lose millions of dollars in future sales. One way to stop these baseless, unsubstituted, and democracy threatening stories is to punish the writers monetarily.
Breitbart is not real news. It's crazy propaganda and Trump seems to be using it like Putin uses RT.
So true. I believe that anything he says about anyone else is an unconscious commentary about himself.
He offers no proof. Yet insists everything from "the media" is "fake news" if people don't reveal their sources. This needs to be strongly called out.
What if ever has he revealed about anything?  Show us your taxes!

Yeah, 8 out of 100, in 33 states. Trump knew nothing of this, and if he did, hes speaking outloud about classified, and/or sensitive intel. Again.

Even if half of 92+ were of similar cause, thats still almost 50 deliberate antisemetic threats.

You like those numbers? Comfortable with an obvious rise in such incidents? Do you have a threshold number of toleration, for such things?
There needs to be a thorough investigation of where T gets his information.  Bannon, Breightbart?  And their proof?
the Birther is Back....or did he ever go away?

Setting aside how absurd it is for our President to be making these types of claims on Twitter, what this really demonstrates is how profoundly idiotic our President is. Either he has confirmed, in public, that the FBI has been investigating him and his associates, or he is paying more attention to Breitbart and Mark Levin than his own intelligence briefings. Presumably, if his staff had told him that the allegations against Obama (by Mark Levin) were indeed false, he would understand that tweeting something like this would only add fuel to the fire. Or, again, perhaps he's too moronic to think that through.

The readers of this paper are not the intended audience of those tweets. The intended audience, credulous, pliant, deluded, has been well trained to attribute all sorts of imagined evils to Barack Hussein Obama, and to trust our current president (shudder) implicitly. Dark times.
Dark times indeed.  With a dark and delusional person occupying our highest elected office.

Trump exaggerated a reality. He must think he's really special. All international calls are monitored as you might all remember from the revelations of the Government surveillance as divulged by Snowden but still widely known prior to that. It wasn't started by Obama. It was mandated legislatively by Congress as specified in the Patriot act and before. Now Trump is just plain full of it.

If there was a national wiretap, it was probably as a result of factual details in international calls that precipitated an investigation. The man's hatred and hatred mongering of Obama is an illness in my view.

Why all the speculation? Mr. McGahn shouldn't waste his Saturday night. Simply call Edward Snowden who has a very transparent relationship with the FIS court. just don t involve Mr. Sessions in the request.
We 'll even find out the contents of the transcripts.
Another BIG LIE. And in all of it I see the hand of Trump's RasPutin, Steve Bannon.

It's "Caine Mutiny" time in the White House now. Has he started counting the strawberries in the kitchen yet?

Btw, nice try to displace the Russian and Sessions stories off the headlines. You, Jeff, Paul, Mike and Jared all committed Treason and are all going to jail.
Oh, let it be so.

To put this in words that Trump will understand; this is bad. President Obama, does not have the authority to tap anybody. If Trump phone calls were not tapped, then Trump is mentally ill. If his phone was tapped, then government employees had reasonable cause to believe that he, or someone speaking to him, were engaged in criminal conduct.
Either way, very bad.

To quote Carl Sagan: "Extraordinary claims require extraordinary proof." Either Trump is a fool, and simply believes things he reads elsewhere without critical analysis. Or a scoundrel, who simply repeats things he knows to be false for political effect. Frankly, though, I have concluded he is both a fool and a scoundrel.
He keeps digging the hole beneath his feet. Keep it up, Trump team, we have plenty more shovels for all of you. The best part of this is that we get to hear from President Obama again.

Perhaps he or his team had some damning conversations with Russia from phones in Trump Tower in that month?

That would be a reason for him to make this claim. That would also be a reason for Breitbart to write such an article under Bannon's direction. It is well known that the current president gets his intelligence from Fox News and Breitbart.
Ishmael, with all due respect, the words "current president" and "intelligence" (in any of its definitions) do not belong in the same sentence.

More of the same old same old psychodrama...whenever cornered by
what amounts to consequences of his own doing, our so called
POTUS lunges out and grabs onto whatever his latest
survey of alt right fantastical made up gibberish finds possibly useful to keep
his faithful fans alert to whom they should blame next for his
own shortcomings.

He is desperately searching for whatever outlets and targets
there are that can temporarily divert his fans' furies lest they
actually gain the time to focus on the surely unbearable truth that the fault lies
in his own heart and immature psyche.

In other words, he needed to have realized a while ago that a reasonable basis exists for believing that his own history and his group's actions vis a vis a circle around Putin are murky and raise suspicions of something that needs to be explained clearly, precisely, and in detail, for the public good.

Unfortunately, "public good" is a notion genuinely foreign to this individual.

As a result, rather than simply do that, e.g. release tax returns, what any publicly responsible leader would have done, he has put up all sorts of silly stonewall type diversions without any evidence, just assertions of innocence that end up easily contradicted by new evidence that subsequently emerges.

Of course this is infuriating. So in his childlike manner he lashes out
without realizing that to do so is also counterproductive, since he
evidently failed to learn this basic lesson as a child.
It's too late, 70 years in the making.

Trump's tweets do sound unhinged. But there's a fair amount of evidence that a Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act (FISA) warrant was issued last fall in relation to communication between Russia and a Trump Tower server. The Times' own Public Editor referred to it in a piece last January: "The Times knew several critical facts: the F.B.I. had a sophisticated investigation underway on Trump’s organization, possibly including FISA warrants. (Some news outlets now report that the F.B.I. did indeed have such warrants, an indication of probable cause.) "
The FBI is not President Obama.  Trump said that Obama ordered a wire-tap of Trump's phone.  Obama did not do that.

So is there a FISA warrant or not?  If the Tmes has proof of the warrant, as several news outlets have reported, then why do they not mention it in the article?  If there is no warrant, then why is this given such prominence at least on the on line Times?

Sounds like they had every reason to be eavesdropping on Trump Tower - they had reason to believe they were colluding with a foreign power to disrupt an American election, and it's beginning to look like they were right. Them's the rules, pal.

I consider myself a news junkie.  I like to keep up on current events, but Trump is turning my world upside down.  Can't even go one day without some scandal.  For the first time in my life, I have to turn off cable news just to give my brain a rest.
Well said!  Very well said.
I agree with Davie  so far this has been the most outrageous Presidency I have ever witnessed in my 70 years. I also must shut down the TV to stop listening to all of the drama going on in the WH.
Go online and read the Guardian and the Intercept.  Much better than cable news.

Can the CEO of Twitter stop Trump from posting? Can anyone stop Trump from tweeting? It is embarrassing and he is the President of the USA.

As a born and bred American, I dread four years of this. Existential levels of dread. Munch's 'The Scream' comes to mind. If we could fast forward to 4 years later, I would consider it.

Of course the so-called president can be banned from Twitter. Yiannopolous (sorry if spelled wrong) was permanently banned for his malicious activity.

However, given that the entire republican delegation in Congress lacks the spine to address 45's unethical behavior, it is a sure thing that the CEO of Twitter isn't about to take him on.

I don't want him banned from twitter. It provides a picture into the inner workings of his mind. A deranged mind at that. But we need twitter to document the severity of the disease which is revealed more clearly with each tweet.  Keep on tweeting Donnie boy. I love it.

I don't know what guidelines are for Twitter ban, but it seems continual lies & slander, as well as encouraging Russia to hack Hillary as he did during the campaign, should be grounds for banning.
"The Scream"--my Dad and I wore socks with that iconic picture on Inauguration day.

President Tweet as expected could not remain presidential very long. His accusations of Obama smack of desperation and an attempt to change the focus of the investigation of Russian interference with election. Outrageous does not being to describe Trump's slanders.
Only 50 days left?? If ONLY!

I don't know about anyone else, but I've gotten to the point of being very worried about the stability of our country. Not to mention our safety. To have such a mentally unstable person as the president it unnerving at best, dangerous more likely.

When will the Republicans react?
Jeff Sessions and Steve Bannon are the furthest thing from Christian. They are liars and bigots.

It may not be the birther controversy that Trump finally dismissed with a single sentence but it seems like something very similar.  This seems to be President Trump's method of operation.  Throw something out for his supporters to savor and hunger over and eventually deny the situation years later.  Frankly this demeans the office of the presidency but it can't demean the man because if he could go any lower he'd be dead and buried.
